page.title: 04B6295 _ River East Allen
page.content:
{IF YOU HAVE A CAR:- (*)
2.The walk can be shortened by driving the car and parking it near the Allen Mill bridge over the{Thornley {Gate/Catton}road.Starting out at this point,the walking distance will be reduced to about 4.5 miles. On reaching the{B6295}road,turn right,cross the stone{Allen Mill} bridge and in a few metres you will see a signpost on your right marked{ {"To Oakpool".}Follow this footpath and descend with the river on your right , bearing left by the waymark on the tree and walk up to a wicket-gate.As you pass through the gate,you will enter a wild and beautiful stretch of country which must have changed little in the past century. It is full of birdlife-swallows,heron,and moor-hens.
